intro: Lantana leucocarpa f. anomala, commonly known as the white-fruited lantana, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically white or yellow when mature. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in coastal areas and disturbed soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
